Inferring trajectories with MERLoT

Source: R/ti_merlot.R
ti_merlot.Rd

Inferring trajectories with MERLoT

ti_merlot(sigma = "local", distance = "euclidean", ndim = 20L,
  density_norm = TRUE, n_local_lower = 5L, n_local_upper = 7L,
  w_width = 0.1, n_components_to_use = 3L, N_yk = 100L,
  lambda_0 = 4.53999297624849e-05, mu_0 = 0.0025, increaseFactor_mu = 20,
  increaseFactor_lambda = 20, FixEndpoints = FALSE)

Arguments

sigma

Diffusion scale parameter of the Gaussian kernel. A larger sigma might be necessary if the eigenvalues can not be found because of a singularity in the matrix. Must be one of:

  • A character vector: "local" (default) or "global",

  • a numeric global sigma -- a global sigma will be calculated using find_sigmas

  • or a Sigmas-class object.
distance

A dist object, or a character vector specifying which distance metric to use. Allowed measures:

  • Euclidean distance (default),

  • cosine distance (1-corr(c_1, c_2)), or

  • rank correlation distance (1-corr(rank(c_1), rank(c_2)))
ndim

Number of eigenvectors/dimensions to return
density_norm

logical. If TRUE, use density normalisation
n_local_lower

If sigma == 'local', the n_local_lower:n_local_upper nearest neighbor(s) determine(s) the local sigma
n_local_upper

See n_local_lower
w_width

Window width to use for deciding the branch cutoff
n_components_to_use

Which components to use in downstream analysis
N_yk

number of nodes for the elastic principal tree
lambda_0

principal elastic tree energy function parameter.
mu_0

principal elastic tree energy function parameter.
increaseFactor_mu

factor by which the mu will be increased for the embedding
increaseFactor_lambda

factor by which the mu will be increased for the embedding
FixEndpoints

Documentation not provided by authors

Contents

  • Arguments
